intro: Bolax complicata, commonly known as the twisted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are often twisted or curled, giving it its common name. Bolax complicata typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
